A Falling Star's Memories.name: A Falling Star's Memories
A Falling Star's Memories.descriptionHazard: The shaft walls vanish and are replaced by an endless field of stars in all direction, as if the viewer were suddenly lost in outer space.
A Falling Star's Memories.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:40] (master) to unweave the magic left in the wake of the Trinity Star's passage, @Check[thievery|dc:43] (expert) to etch temporary runes to siphon away the magic, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 33) to counteract the magic; three successes are required to disable the trap. Once the PCs are within the trap's overwhelming illusion, they can still attempt these checks to disable it, but the check DCs increase by 2.
A Falling Star's Memories.routine:
A Voyage Through the Infinite (1 action) Every round on its turn, the trap inflicts all creatures in the shaft with the perception that they have been hurtling at an unimaginable speed through the vastness of space. The stars are so distant that no indication of movement can be observed or felt beyond that overwhelming mental conviction. At the same time, the creatures feel as if something unimaginably powerful and hungry is chasing them... and gaining on them. Any PC who looks over their shoulder sees that the stars are indeed winking out behind them, as if an immense black object were growing closer or as if the stars themselves were vanishing. While the PC's body is somehow protected by the vastness of space, their minds are not—each PC must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save.

Critical Success As success below, but the creature also realizes they're reliving the memories of Runelord Xanderghul—like him, they're escaping some sort of horrific fate and are hurtling toward Golarion. The next time this creature achieves a critical success against this trap, they suddenly see Golarion loom large, and as they witness their "crash" into the Throne of the Troll King, they suddenly wake, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, in area C1 at the heart Xin-Cyrusian. If any other PCs are still trapped in the Falling Star's Memories, a PC in Xin-Cyrusian knows instinctively that they can call out to those trapped PCs—each PC in Xin-Cyrusian who does so reduces the save DC against A Voyage Through the Infinite for those still trapped by 5.

Success The creature realizes they're experiencing the path the Trinity Star took through the cosmos and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature's grip on reality fades as they experience what seems like years or even decades of hurtling adrift through a vast expanse. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours or increases the value of their stupefied condition by 1 if they're already stupefied.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (or increase the stupefied condition by 2).

Special If this trap would cause a creature's stupefied condition to exceed @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 5}, the creature instead "crashes" to the ground on the hilltop outside, about ten feet from the Throne of the Troll King. The creature takes @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save), and their stupefied condition now has an unlimited duration.

action->Moment of Glory.name: Moment of Glory
action->Moment of Glory.description:
Trigger A creature moves (or falls) more than 60 feet down the shaft below the illusory throne

Effect All creatures in the shaft suddenly witness an endless night sky all around them, as if they were hurtling through outer space with no sign of any nearby planetary bodies. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save to resist being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 24 hours as the visual overwhelms them. The trap then rolls initiative.

Abysium Sentinel.name: Abysium Sentinel
Abysium Sentinel.publicNotes:
This creature is crafted from a toxic skymetal known as abysium.

Thassilonian sentinels are crafted in the shapes of skulls or heads.

Sentinel Sets

Thassilonian sentinels were typically carved from marble, ivory, and bronze, easily blending in with most statues. Rarer sentinels carved from wood, coral, and skymetals were often commissioned in sets alongside matching statues to ensure seamless fits or were carefully sculpted for display alone.

action->Green Glow.name: Green Glow
action->Green Glow.description: 15 feet. A creature beginning its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that's already sickened instead becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} on a failure (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) for 24 hours.

action->Security Alert.name: Security Alert
action->Security Alert.description:
Trigger The abysium sentinel becomes aware of an unfamiliar creature

Effect The abysium sentinel alerts its owner of an intruder, either with a mental or audible alarm, depending on established orders. The mental alarm has a range of 1 mile.

action->Statue's Head.name: Statue's Head
action->Statue's Head.description: Until the next time it acts, the abysium sentinel appears to be the head of a statue it's perched atop. It has an automatic result of 58 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as nothing more than a statue's head.

action->Adaptive Rune Magic.name: Adaptive Rune Magic
action->Adaptive Rune Magic.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Aethusa Casts a Spell of 6th rank or higher

Effect Aethusa momentarily infuses her preferred form of sin magic (sloth) with the power of either gluttony or greed magic. The triggering spell slot is expended, but instead of the spell's normal effects, Aethusa casts either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination} at 6th rank.

action->Past Lives.name: Past Lives
action->Past Lives.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Aethusa accesses what she believes to be the memories of two previous runelords. For the next 1 minute, whenever Aethusa makes a skill check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}, she rolls three times and uses the highest result.

action->Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
action->Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Aethusa's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Aethusa's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Aethusa's Prison.name: Aethusa's Prison
Aethusa's Prison.descriptionHazard: A roiling sphere of chromatic energy floats above a pedestal marked with arcane symbols.
Aethusa's Prison.disable: @Check[nature|dc:42] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:45] (master) to remove an immunity the prison currently has to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire (this effect lasts until the prison uses its Energy Immunity reaction to regain that immunity); @Check[arcana|dc:42] (master) to fortify the pedestal's containment runes, preventing the prison from using its Chromatic Eruption action for 1 round and causing it to suffer feedback that inflicts @Damage[20[untyped]] damage (this damage bypasses the prison's hardness and immunities); @Check[thievery|dc:42] (master) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 34) to suppress the pedestal's containment runes for 1 round, preventing the prison from using its Self-Repair action and causing it to suffer feedback that inflicts @Damage[20[untyped]] damage (this damage bypasses the prison's hardness and immunities). Unlike most hazards, Aethusa's prison can't be disabled, but it can be destroyed by reducing it to 0 Hit Points.
Aethusa's Prison.reset: The trap deactivates and then resets automatically when it repairs to its maximum Hit Points.
Aethusa's Prison.routine: (2 actions) The prison uses its first action to Self-Repair. If the hazard has less than its maximum Hit Points, it then uses its Chromatic Eruption action.

action->Lockdown Protocol.name: Lockdown Protocol
action->Lockdown Protocol.description:
Trigger The prison takes any damage

Effect The prison uses its Chromatic Eruption action as part of this reaction, then gains immunity to the triggering damage type until the hazard resets. The hazard then rolls initiative.

action->Self-Repair.name: Self-Repair
action->Self-Repair.description: The prison regains @Damage[30[healing]] Hit Points. Then, if the prison is at maximum Hit Points, the hazard deactivates and immediately resets.

action->Chromatic Eruption.name: Chromatic Eruption
action->Chromatic Eruption.description:
Requirements The prison has less than its maximum Hit Points

Effect Tendrils of uncontained magical energy lash at creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], dealing @Damage[10d6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save) of a randomly determined type. Roll [[/gmr 1d4]]: 1–acid, 2–cold, 3–electricity, 4–fire.

action->Energy Immunity.name: Energy Immunity
action->Energy Immunity.description:
Trigger The prison takes acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage

Effect The prison takes the damage but then gains immunity to the triggering damage type until the hazard resets.

Ancient One.name: Ancient One
Ancient One.publicNotes:
In the Dimension of Time, creatures clad in tattered robes float between encapsulated bubbles of still, captured moments, untethered to any other place, unspeaking and unseeing. The few mortals to meet these enigmatic, faceless creatures have never known them to identify by any name other than the ancient ones, seemingly holding no identity (or no identity they wish to share) beyond their relationship with time.

The ancients profess to have always existed in the Dimension of Time, and for time to have always existed in the Great Beyond. Most reside in Stethelos, the storied city at the center of time, though they're also found wandering the Void, crossing the strangest corners of the Maelstrom where it lies between other planes, and occasionally, venturing into dark corners of the Universe. They serve at the will of Tawil at'Umr, the All in One and the One in All, an avatar of Yog-Sothoth lurking deep within time as Stethelos's caretaker. Though the ancient ones resemble their master in stature and attire, and though none would describe Tawil at'Umr as anything other than ancient in origin, most scholars consider "ancient one" a classification of its own separate from that of Great Old One, and Tawil at'Umr is definitively counted among the Great Old Ones by all who know it.

Where Yog-Sothoth is an embodiment of all space and time, an entity who concerns himself with guarding cosmic secrets, the ancient ones are philosophers and mystics seeking ever more enlightenment. They search, have searched, and will search across time indefinitely and, having found entropy and disorder, conclude this to be the Great Beyond's ultimate purpose. When a new creature dawns, it's pristine and whole—perfectly ordered—for but a single moment before it can be eroded by Pharasma's poison, accumulating decay, change, and chaos, until finally it reaches its ending, when time leaves a twilight creature broken and gone. Law and chaos, the ancient ones believe, aren't opposing or even separate forces, but a single expression of reality viewed from two angles, different from each other only in time.

How Old is Time?

Lying in parallel with the Great Beyond with a presence felt on nearly every plane, from the Inner Sphere to the Outer Rifts, the Dimension of Time holds too many secrets for a reality so seemingly omnipresent. Can a world truly be said to begin before time is there to start? Scholars say Pharasma is the oldest being in the Great Beyond, a survivor of some previous multiverse's collapse, but does the Lady of Graves predate time, or did she bring the Dimension of Time with her so history could begin everything anew?

Into the Dimension of Time

The Dimension of Time is one of the most difficult and complex realms in the Great Beyond to travel to, with restrictions on its access limiting all but the most powerful of planar travelers from visiting it. At the GM's discretion, though, items looted from an ancient one, or even just fragments torn from their robes, could function as the planar key needed to allow a PC to use interplanar teleport to access the Dimension of Time.

action->Entropy Sense.name: Entropy Sense
action->Entropy Sense.description: The ancient one can predict the presence of a creature through supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance and builds a perception of reality from this information, allowing them to "see" as a precise sense in the listed range. Invisible creatures are visible to them, but veil of privacy prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

action->Remove a Condition.name: Remove a Condition
action->Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one ends one condition affecting them.

action->Mythic Resilience (Will).name: Mythic Resilience (Will)
action->Mythic Resilience (Will).description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.

action->No Breath.name: No Breath
action->No Breath.description: An ancient one doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poisons).

action->Otherworldly Mind.name: Otherworldly Mind
action->Otherworldly Mind.description: Whenever a creature targets the ancient one with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[6d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:39|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->The Connection Cuts Both Ways.name: The Connection Cuts Both Ways
action->The Connection Cuts Both Ways.description: Creatures the ancient one affected with a mental effect or communicated with telepathically within the last round can hijack the ancient one's telepathic connection; they automatically ignore the ancient one's immunity to auditory, emotion, and visual effects until the end of their current turn. They can additionally spend 1 Mythic Point as a free action to reach through the connection to manipulate the ancient one's mind, ignoring the ancient one's mythic resilience on Will saving throws.

action->Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
action->Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of the Ancient One's Mythic Points

Trigger The ancient one would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one remains conscious, and recovers 50% of their maximum Hit Points.

action->Unified Timeline.name: Unified Timeline
action->Unified Timeline.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement within 10 feet of the ancient one

Effect Ancient ones exist spread out across infinite times and places simultaneously and can shift themselves through their catalog of potentialities. The ancient one teleports themself and the triggering creature into empty squares within 10 feet of their respective positions, though the triggering creature can't be moved into hazardous terrain or to a place it can't stand. An unwilling creature can resist the teleportation with a successful @Check[will|dc:42] save.

action->Dismantle All Life.name: Dismantle All Life
action->Dismantle All Life.description: Time and entropy end all things, even the undead. When the ancient one's Strikes hit a creature with void healing, they deal vitality damage instead of void damage. The ancient one can't use their Strikes to restore Hit Points to living or undead creatures.

action->Recharge.name: Recharge
action->Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one regains an expended spell.

action->Reroll.name: Reroll
action->Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger The ancient one fails a check

Effect The ancient one rerolls the check.

action->Slither Between Worlds.name: Slither Between Worlds
action->Slither Between Worlds.description: The ancient one instantly transports themself and any items they're wearing and holding from their current space to an unoccupied space within 100 feet they can see. Once per turn, the ancient one can spend 1 Mythic Point to slither between worlds as a free action on their turn.

action->Vision of Lost Meaning.name: Vision of Lost Meaning
action->Vision of Lost Meaning.description:
The ancient one speaks without sound, contacting a creature within 120 feet telepathically to send out waves of visions that fill its mind with fragmented thoughts, unrealized chaos, and futures where its choices are never consequential. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is disoriented by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The target is overwhelmed by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

weapon->Timeflaying Blade.name: Timeflaying Blade
weapon->Timeflaying Blade.description:
Timeflaying blades are forged around shards of collapsed paradoxes. Their existence is largely an enigma. In the furthest corners of esoteric scholarship, they're mentioned in passing or simply alluded to without ever being named outright. They're associated with Stethelos, the legendary city said to lie at the heart of the Dimension of Time, though it's unclear if they were made there, were discovered there, or are bound to return there at the end of time itself.

A timeflaying blade is a +3 greater striking greater corrosive keen quickstrike orichalcum bastard sword. Acid damage caused by a timeflaying blade appears not to be caused by liquid, but by the act of material simply eroding away into dust as if thousands of years passed in an instant (this doesn't impact a creature or object's acid immunity, resistance, or weakness, though).

Activate—Flay Time 1 (concentrate, incapacitation, manipulate)

Frequency once per minute

Effect Spend 1 Mythic Point. You swing the timeflaying blade through the air as if slicing something while you attempt to sever a creature within 120 feet from time itself. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:43] save.

Critical Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Success The creature is hurled [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} into the future. They disappear in a flash of white light, only to reappear in the same space on their initiative after the duration. If that space is occupied, the creature is shunted harmlessly aside to the closest unoccupied space.

Failure As success, but the creature is hurled forward in time [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes}.

Critical Failure As success, but the creature is hurled into an entirely alternate timeline. At your discretion, the creature's gear is left behind in your timeline. Whether or not the creature will ever return to your timeline depends on the GM's whim, but at the very least, it should never return within the span of a year's passing.

Animate Nightmare.name: Animate Nightmare
Animate Nightmare.publicNotes:
Whereas animate dreams form from the fears of specific individuals, animate nightmares are spawned by the terrors that beset civilizations. An animate nightmare's appearance depends on the type of fear that created it, but, like fears, result in similar forms.

Emigrants From Dreams

Animate nightmares often haunt the ruins of the civilization that birthed them. Others are drawn to Jandelay, the enigmatic demiplane where the fragments of dead worlds are preserved for all eternity, or to Abaddon, where apocalyptic nihilism is the rule. These latter nightmares might stay close to their "parent" civilizations, while others wander the broken avenues of multiple worlds, feeding off the traces of fear that linger in those places.
Animate Nightmare.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Apocalyptic Embodiment.name: Apocalyptic Embodiment
action->Apocalyptic Embodiment.description:
An animate nightmare embodies one societal fear, chosen from the following options. Depending on the choice, the animate nightmare gains one additional 8th-rank occult innate spell, as listed below.

Disaster The animate nightmare appears as a person or creature who's suffered devastating wounds from a calamity—horrific burns, crushed and broken limbs, impalements from wind-tossed debris, and the like. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity} at 8th rank.

Disorder The animate nightmare looks like a distorted parody of a commonplace person with unnaturally long limbs, a twisted visage, and a scratching shrill voice. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Confusion} at 8th rank.

Famine The animate nightmare appears as a humanoid carrion bird or other bestial scavenger (such as a jackal or a fly) on the brink of death from starvation. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination} at 8th rank.

Plague The animate nightmare is shaped like a tangle of diseased bodies animated into hideous life that might have just crawled out of a mass grave. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MS60WhVifb45qORJ]{Spiritual Epidemic} at 8th rank.

action->Panicking Touch.name: Panicking Touch
action->Panicking Touch.description:
Requirements The animate nightmare's previous action was a nightmare tendril Strike against a creature

Effect The animate nightmare's touch lingers and infuses the mind of the creature it just attempted to Strike. The creature takes @Damage[8d6[persistent,mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:38|basic] save). If the creature is already taking persistent mental damage from Panicking Touch, it must instead succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or endure a different effect based on the animate nightmare's apocalyptic embodiment; this additional effect lasts as long as the persistent mental damage lasts.

Disaster The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and can't reduce its frightened condition.

Disorder The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}.

Famine The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Plague The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Animus of Longing.name: Animus of Longing
Animus of Longing.descriptionHazard: Three pitchers pour water in an endless cascade, each decorated with a symbol of fertility, fecundity, and desire. The pitchers never empty, and the fountain below never overflows; the entire thing flickers with eerie red energy.
Animus of Longing.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:50] (legendary) or @Check[society|dc:50] (legendary) to decipher the symbols and runes scribed across on the runewell and pinpoint which runes can be used to deactivate it, @Check[thievery|dc:53] (legendary) to temporarily disrupt the anima focus's connection to the Eye of Desire or to destroy a phantom of desire; three total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying a phantom of desire counts as a single success)
Animus of Longing.reset: The animus of longing deactivates as soon as no foes remain in the atrium, then immediately resets.
Animus of Longing.routine: (1 action) On its turn, the animus of longing sustains the three phantoms of desire. The three creatures each take their turn.
Animus of Longing.stealth: (legendary) to detect the dangerous and sealed entrance to the Eye of Desire; noticing the anima focus itself has a DC of 0

action->Shroud of Passion's Might.name: Shroud of Passion's Might
action->Shroud of Passion's Might.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to use the anima focus to open the way into the Eye of Desire

Effect The Runewell of Lust's magic reaches out of the Eye of Desire and into the minds of all nearby creatures, creating vivid, dreamlike hallucinations fulfilling their greatest desires. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save with the following effects. The hazard then manifests three phantoms of desire—incarnations of Runelord Sorshen empowered by certain beliefs that she hasn't actually turned over a proverbial new leaf and is playing a long-con game to take over the world. The phantoms and the hazard then roll initiative.

Critical Success The creature understands the false nature of the hallucination but gleans useful insights from what they see, gaining a +2 status bonus to one Perception check, saving throw, or skill check made before the end of their next turn.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round, then recognizes the hallucination for what it is and blocks it from their mind.

Failure The creature becomes lost in the hallucination, struggling to tell it apart from reality. The creature becomes dazzled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as they remain in Sorshen's atrium. At the end of each of the creature's turns, it may attempt a new @Check[will|dc:44] save to end this effect.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}, and the Will save to end the effect is DC 48.

Apocalypse Stormfront.name: Apocalypse Stormfront
Apocalypse Stormfront.descriptionHazard: An endless void stretches in all directions. Visions of Golarion's destruction roll like storm clouds across the space.
Apocalypse Stormfront.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:47] to Fly through the space without becoming stuck in the webs, @Check[athletics|dc:50] to Climb the webs and make progress forward through the infinite, @Check[nature|dc:47] or @Check[occultism|dc:47] or @Check[arcana|dc:50] or @Check[religion|dc:50] (legendary) to collapse the extradimensional space, or @Check[perception|dc:52] to peer through the visions of Golarion to notice discrepancies that help keep the overwhelming despair from setting in; six successes disables the hazard, causing it to vanish forever and shunting all creatures to Liralarue's Prison.
Apocalypse Stormfront.reset: The hazard resets automatically once no creatures are in the area.
Apocalypse Stormfront.routine:
(1 action) (arcane, emotion, illusion, mental) A stormfront filled with illusory scenes of Golarion's destruction rolls through the extradimensional space. Each creature in the hazard's area takes @Damage[6d12[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:42|basic|traits:arcane,emotion,illusion,mental] save). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure). A PC reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage is shunted back into area C7.

A creature that takes damage while Climbing the webs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or fall. A creature can try to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} (@Check[reflex|dc:40]). On a success, they lose one success they've earned to escape the hazard but otherwise arrest their fall. On a failure, they plummet into the void, losing all Athletics successes they've earned to escape the hazard. Each round on their turn, the character can try to Grab an Edge again, but each time they fail to do so, the party must earn an additional success to escape the hazard. Characters who fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or repeatedly fail to Grab an Edge might effectively become lost in the void, though once the nightmare hazard is disabled, they appear along with the rest of the PCs in Liralarue's Prison.

action->Brewing Storm.name: Brewing Storm
action->Brewing Storm.description:
Trigger A creature enters the shaft leading to area C8

Effect Storm clouds roiling with gouts of fire, bolts of lightning, and the wails of uncountable souls form in the distance. The hazard then rolls initiative.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

action->Remove a Condition.name: Remove a Condition
action->Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu ends one condition affecting her.

action->Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and.name: Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will)
action->Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and.description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.

action->Rejection Vulnerability.name: Rejection Vulnerability
action->Rejection Vulnerability.description: Areelu Vorlesh's apotheosis into a demon has made her vulnerable to rejection like a succubus. When Areelu fails a Deception check to Embrace or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}, or when a creature succeeds at its save against her mental spells or abilities, she takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage. For 1 hour after causing mental damage to Areelu in this way, the creature can deal @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage to her with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action incorporating its rejection.

action->Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
action->Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Areelu's Mythic Points

Trigger Areelu would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu remains standing and conscious and recovers @Damage[200[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Embrace.name: Embrace
action->Embrace.description: Areelu attempts to [[/act grapple skill=deception]] a creature using her Deception bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, Areelu automatically succeeds.

action->Kiss of Locusts.name: Kiss of Locusts
action->Kiss of Locusts.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Areelu engages a creature she has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in an embrace or other act of passion, creating an opportunity for a cloud of locusts to enter the creature's body. The creature takes @Damage[5d6[persistent,bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for as long as they remain sickened.

action->Recharge.name: Recharge
action->Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu regains an expended spell slot.

action->Reroll.name: Reroll
action->Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger Areelu fails a check

Effect Areelu rerolls the check.

Ayavah.name: Ayavah
Ayavah.allSavesBonus: +1 status to saves against spells and magic effects

equipment->Crafter's Eyepiece (Greater).name: Crafter's Eyepiece (Greater)
equipment->Crafter's Eyepiece (Greater).description:
This rugged metal eyepiece etched with square patterns is designed to be worn over a single eye. Twisting the lens reveals a faint three-dimensional outline of an item you plan to build or repair, with helpful labels on the component parts.

You gain a +2 item bonus to Crafting checks. When you Repair an item, increase the Hit Points restored to 10 + 10 per proficiency rank on a success or 15 + 15 per proficiency rank on a critical success.

Activate—Prototype 1 minute (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You calibrate the eyepiece to have it cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TUj8eugNqAvB1vVR]{Creation} spell over the course of 1 minute to construct a temporary item.

equipment->Masquerade Scarf (Greater).name: Masquerade Scarf (Greater)
equipment->Masquerade Scarf (Greater).description:
This delicately embroidered scarf matches with every outfit and can even complete a costume or disguise with illusions.

Activate—Masquerade 2 (manipulate)

Effect You arrange the scarf over your lower face, and it casts a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} spell on you, which ends immediately if the scarf is removed. You can alter the scarf's appearance or make it invisible as part of the illusory disguise, but it can still be felt if touched.

equipment->Shining Symbol (Greater).name: Shining Symbol (Greater)
equipment->Shining Symbol (Greater).description:
If you worship a deity, this golden amulet transforms into your deity's religious symbol when you invest it. You gain a +2 item bonus to Religion. The symbol casts dim light in a @Template[emanation|distance:20].

Activate—Spiritual Light 2 (concentrate, light, revelation)

Frequency once per day

Effect The light cast by the symbol becomes bright light for 10 minutes and shines through bodies to reveal hints of the spirits within. Creatures in the light receive a –2 status penalty to Deception and Stealth checks, and while it's active your enemies in the light gain weakness 5 to spirit damage.

You can Dismiss this activation.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.NNxguHneoM3NvW1S]{Aura: Shining Symbol}

Craft Requirements You must be holy or unholy.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Bloodline Focus.name: Bloodline Focus
action->Bloodline Focus.description: When Ayavah Refocuses, she completely fills her focus pool.

action->Corruption of Sin.name: Corruption of Sin
action->Corruption of Sin.description: When Ayavah casts a bloodline spell using a Focus Point or one of the following spells: blister, disintegrate, divine wrath, enlarge, fear, or slow, she can choose to either give a target a –1 status penalty to AC for 1 round or gain a +2 status bonus to Intimidation checks for 1 round.

action->Legendary Sculptor.name: Legendary Sculptor
action->Legendary Sculptor.description: Ayavah makes Crafting checks associated with sculpture at legendary proficiency. If she rolls a failure on a Crafting check involving sculpture, she gets a success instead.

action->Reach Spell.name: Reach Spell
action->Reach Spell.description: If the next action Ayavah takes is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Baolen.name: Baolen
Baolen.publicNotes: A kraken is an enormous, squid-like leviathan with a cruel intelligence. It hunts ships, whales, and heroes alike. The hatred and envy krakens hold for alghollthus, their rivals, has led many krakens to make their lairs in sunken cities, where they can sift through ancient lore and uncover long-lost arcane secrets.

action->Remove a Condition.name: Remove a Condition
action->Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The creature ends one condition affecting it.

action->Altered Weather.name: Altered Weather
action->Altered Weather.description:
A kraken reshapes the weather within 2 miles of it, with the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XkDCzMIyc0YOjw05]{Control Weather} ritual centered on the kraken and based on its emotional state, at the GM's discretion. If the kraken dies, the weather returns to normal immediately.

Baolen is currently content in his place as an object of worship, though, so the surrounding weather remains calm.

action->Susceptible to Confusion.name: Susceptible to Confusion
action->Susceptible to Confusion.description: Baolen's mythic resilience doesn't apply to Will saving throws he makes against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} condition. If Baolen starts his turn confused, he takes @Damage[6d10[mental]] damage.

action->Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
action->Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Baolen's Mythic Points

Trigger Baolen would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Baolen remains standing and conscious, and recovers 50% of his maximum Hit Points.

action->Constrict.name: Constrict
action->Constrict.description:
@Damage[(2d10+17)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]. On a failed save, a creature that is holding its breath loses [[/gmr 1d4 #Lost rounds of air from Constrict]]{1d4 rounds} worth of air.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Curse of Flawed History.name: Curse of Flawed History
action->Curse of Flawed History.description:
Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:37]

Effect The target struggles to differentiate between alternate histories and how the past truly occurred. The creature takes a –2 status penalty to checks made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} (or a –4 penalty on a critical failure). This curse has an unlimited duration.

action->Double Attack.name: Double Attack
action->Double Attack.description:
The kraken makes two Strikes with two different arms or tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. Double Attack counts as two attacks toward the kraken's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made.

If the kraken subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Double Attack.

action->Ink Cloud.name: Ink Cloud
action->Ink Cloud.description:
The kraken releases a cloud of black, venomous ink in an @Template[emanation|distance:80]. This cloud has no effect outside water.

Creatures inside the ink cloud are exposed to retrocognitive ink poison and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} while inside the cloud.

The kraken can't use Ink Cloud again for [[/br 2d6 #Recharge Ink Cloud]]{2d6 rounds}, and the cloud dissipates after 1 minute.

action->Jet.name: Jet
action->Jet.description: The kraken moves through the water up to 280 feet in a straight line without triggering reactions.

action->Mythic Power.name: Mythic Power
action->Mythic Power.description: The creature has a pool of 3 Mythic Points, and can spend those Mythic Points for any of the actions it has.

action->Recharge.name: Recharge
action->Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Baolen regains an expended spell.

action->Retrocognitive Ink.name: Retrocognitive Ink
action->Retrocognitive Ink.description:
Baolen is immune to this poison

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:40]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and the target is exposed to the curse of flawed history (1 round)

Belimarius.name: Belimarius
Belimarius.allSavesBonus: +1 status vs. magical effects, +4 status vs. mental effects HP 350; Immunities aging, disease; R

weapon->Belimarius's Invidious Halberd.name: Belimarius's Invidious Halberd
weapon->Belimarius's Invidious Halberd.description:
Perception +29; darkvision, imprecise hearing within 60 feet

Communication speech (Azlanti, Elven, Thassilonian)

Skills Arcana [[/gmr 1d20+33 #Arcana]]{+33}, Deception [[/gmr 1d20+29 #Deception]]{+29}, Society [[/gmr 1d20+31 #Society]]{+31}

Int +8, Wis +6, Cha +4

Will [[/gmr 1d20+31 #Will]]{+31}

Belimarius's Invidious Halberd is a +3 greater striking keen spell reservoir high-grade dawnsilver halberd (at this time, their spell reservoir contains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}). As the halberd passed from the hands of one runelord of envy to the next, the halberd's self-loathing and hatred of the arcane spellcasters they were forced to serve grew. Their own limited arcane magic paled in comparison to their powerful wielders, after all, and the halberd seethed at this perceived inequality. They only grudgingly abide their wielders—runelord or otherwise—and are only truly happy when they're used to cut down those who can cast arcane spells. The halberd can use 3 actions per turn, acting on their wielder's turn, and has a reaction. These actions and reaction don't count against their wielder's.

Activate—Absorb Arcana r (arcane, concentrate)

Trigger The halberd damages a creature capable of casting arcane spells

Effect The halberd attempts to absorb one of the creature's prepared arcane spells or arcane spell slots. If the creature struck fails a @Check[will|dc:37] save, it loses an arcane spell (or lose an unused arcane spell slot) as if it'd cast that spell. The spell or slot lost is randomly determined from the highest rank available, starting at 6th rank and working down. The halberd passes this absorbed energy on to their wielder, who becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round and can use the extra action only to Strike with the halberd.

Activate—Detonate Magic 2 (arcane, concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect The halberd casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kUSShxXzY1sPtJA0]{Detonate Magic} (DC 37).

Activate—Manipulate Mind 2 (arcane, concentrate)

Frequency once per hour

Effect The halberd casts a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory} (DC 37).

Activate—Shattermind f (arcane, concentrate)

Trigger The halberd critically hits a creature capable of casting arcane spells

Effect The creature struck is targeted with a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Never Mind} spell (DC 37).

Destruction Belimarius's Invidious Halberd is destroyed if it's hurled under the feet of the Oliphaunt of Jandelay while there's no current runelord of envy living in the world.

armor->Robes of Xin-Edasseril.name: Robes of Xin-Edasseril
armor->Robes of Xin-Edasseril.description: These robes, the traditional raiment of the runelord of envy, function as +3 greater resilient antimagic greater energy-resistant explorer's clothing. The energy resistance granted by these robes can be selected from acid, cold, electricity, or fire when you perform your daily preparations—without these preparations, the robes default to cold resistance. The robe's pockets function as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.V1XhLQPWjdQz759K]{Retrieval Belt (Major)}.

equipment->Aeon Stone (Amplifying).name: Aeon Stone (Amplifying)
equipment->Aeon Stone (Amplifying).description:
Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful Disarm action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

An Amplifying aeon stone must be activated to provide a benefit. The resonant power grants you a +2 item bonus to Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion checks-whichever corresponds to the tradition of the last spell you enhanced with this aeon stone.

Activate—Amplify 1 (concentrate, spellshape)

Effect If your next action is to Cast a Spell, that spell's rank is 1 higher (maximum 10th rank) for the purposes of counteracting and being counteracted.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.kdcVvwVVsttZgX1Y]{Effect: Aeon Stone Resonance (Amplifying)}

equipment->Aeon Stone (Nourishing).name: Aeon Stone (Nourishing)
equipment->Aeon Stone (Nourishing).description:

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

After you've invested and worn this transparent stone for a week continuously, you no longer need to eat or drink. This time resets if you remove the aeon stone or it's invested by someone else.

The resonant power allows you to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.W69zswpj0Trdy5rj]{Air Bubble} as a primal innate spell once per day.

equipment->Aeon Stone (Preserving).name: Aeon Stone (Preserving)
equipment->Aeon Stone (Preserving).description:
Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful Disarm action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

This red crystalline star covers you in a faint aura when you are subject to lingering wounds. You gain resistance 3 to persistent damage. At the end of any turn where the persistent damage can't overcome this resistance, end that condition.

The resonant power allows you to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnjhtQYexDtNDdEg]{Stabilize} as a primal innate cantrip.

equipment->Belt of Long Life.name: Belt of Long Life
equipment->Belt of Long Life.description:
This thick leather belt is engraved with imagery of an ancient tree. You gain 15 temporary Hit Points the first time you invest the belt in a day. When you invest the belt, you either increase your Constitution modifier by 1 or increase it to +4, whichever would give you a higher value.

Activate—Call Upon the Ancient Life 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You draw upon the lifegiving energy of the tree on the belt to gain rapid healing. For [[/br 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, at the start of your turn each round, you recover 15 Hit Points.

consumable->Wand of Mountain Resilience.name: Wand of Mountain Resilience (Rank 4)
consumable->Wand of Mountain Resilience.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2BV2yYPfVJ5zirZt]{Mountain Resilience}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated rank.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of the spell at the listed rank.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

effect->Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: Spell Effect: Hidden Mind
effect->Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}

You gain a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects.

action->Remove a Condition.name: Remove a Condition
action->Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius ends one condition affecting her.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Immortality.name: Immortality
action->Immortality.description: Belimarius is immortal and immune to the negative effects of aging and disease, and she's resistant to mental damage. Her immortality doesn't prevent her death from other means.

action->Never Enough.name: Never Enough
action->Never Enough.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet casts a spell with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, wood, or void trait that deals damage

Effect Belimarius seethes with jealousy at another spellcaster's magical accomplishments. She regains @Damage[25[healing]] Hit Points, and until the end of her next turn, Belimarius's spell DC increases by 1, and her spell attacks gain a +1 circumstance bonus.

action->Spell Riposte.name: Spell Riposte
action->Spell Riposte.description:
Trigger Belimarius is the target of a spell she's aware of

Effect Belimarius attempts to counteract the triggering spell with a [[/r 1d20+35 #Counteract]]{+35} counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 10. If the triggering spell would be counteracted, it instead continues with the caster as a target instead of Belimarius.

action->Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
action->Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Belimarius's Mythic Points

Trigger Belimarius would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius remains standing and conscious, and recovers @Damage[175[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Manifest Halberd.name: Manifest Halberd
action->Manifest Halberd.description:
Requirements Belimarius has a free hand and isn't holding her Invidious Halberd

Effect Belimarius calls her Invidious Halberd, and it appears in one of her hands.

action->Mythic Ascension.name: Mythic Ascension
action->Mythic Ascension.description:
Trigger Runelord Belimarius reduces a mythic creature to 0 HP, or the PCs take more than 24 hours to confront her after securing entrance to the Eye of Desire

Effect The warshard Belimarius has fused with the Runewell of Lust flares with a sudden flash of blood-red light. Belimarius gains the mythic trait, 3 Mythic Points, and her Mythic Powers. In time, she might develop additional mythic powers, but only if she survives her encounter with the PCs.

action->Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
action->Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Runelord Belimarius's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell of 8th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

action->Recharge.name: Recharge
action->Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius regains an expended spell.

action->Sacrifice Warshard.name: Sacrifice Warshard
action->Sacrifice Warshard.description:
Trigger Belimarius begins her turn

Requirements Belimarius has the warshard of Gorum held in a hand

Effect While its mythic potential and divine power has largely been used to transform the Eye of Desire and the Runewell of Lust into the forms described in Chapter 1 to enable her imminent mythic ascension, enough power remains within to generate one final effect. With a quick motion, Belimarius crushes the mostly depleted warshard she holds in her hand, destroying it and causing red rain to cascade down around her in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] (which easily fills the entirety of the Eye of Desire). Allies in this area (Belimarius and her two knights of malice) become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute but can use the extra action only to Strike with a melee weapon. Foes in the area (including the PCs) must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save.

Critical Success The creature absorbs some of Gorum's legacy and gains 1 Mythic Point that they must spend before the end of their next turn.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is overwhelmed with despair at Gorum's death and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} with despair at Gorum's death. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save to end the effect, with the DC lowered by 2 each subsequent round.

Bittersweet Mask.name: Bittersweet Mask
Bittersweet Mask.descriptionHazard: The many iron bars of this iron mask fits tightly around Javownir's head and snout, looking almost as if it was built in place to conform specifically to the shape of his skull with no apparent latch or hinge for it to be removed.
Bittersweet Mask.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:45] (expert) twice to find the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} latches, @Check[athletics|dc:48] (master) to wrench the mask open quickly enough to prevent it from triggering before it's destroyed, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th-rank; counteract DC 35), or automatic with Spleen's key
Bittersweet Mask.reset: The mask resets automatically at the start of the round after it is triggered.

action->Linked to Javownir.name: Linked to Javownir
action->Linked to Javownir.description: Whenever the mask takes damage, Javownir takes the same damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save)

action->Toxic Off-gassing.name: Toxic Off-gassing
action->Toxic Off-gassing.description:
Trigger The mask takes damage, or an Athletics check to wrench it free fails or critically fails

Effect The mask creates a cloud of poison gas in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around Javownir. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(6d12+41)[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:44|basic] save; Javownir treats the result of this save as one degree of success worse than the rolled result).

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description:
A Bittersweet Sister adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

action->Moonlight's Kiss.name: Moonlight's Kiss
action->Moonlight's Kiss.description:
A moon hag in an area illuminated by moonlight gains a +2 status bonus to AC and initiative rolls. In the light of a full moon, they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}, and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If the moon hag has a fly Speed, they can use the extra action to Fly as well.

Any time they're outside of the oubliette or in area C7 they are in moonlight.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The moon hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Dreadful Prediction.name: Dreadful Prediction
action->Dreadful Prediction.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The moon hag howls a series of dreadful, apocalyptic predictions at a single creature within 30 feet, shattering its perceptions of reality. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save and takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the save if it can see the moon. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure) until the curse is removed. Regardless of the outcome, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

action->Ride the Moonbeams.name: Ride the Moonbeams
action->Ride the Moonbeams.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The moon hag teleports themself and any items they're wearing and holding to another space within 30 feet, or 60 feet if they're in moonlight. They then gain a 25-foot fly Speed until the end of their next turn. If the moon hag is in the air when the effect ends, they float to the ground, taking no falling damage.

Any time they're outside of the oubliette or in area C7 they are in moonlight.

Cataclysmic Planar Rift.name: Cataclysmic Planar Rift
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.descriptionHazard: This apocalypse represents the effects of numerous planar rifts forming and exploding in a region, with the risk of the planar fabric being compromised enough to tear a city-sized (if not larger) hole in reality. These rifts are likely to eject inhabitants of the other plane into the Universe, as well as serve as gateways for furious defenders to pour through to punish anyone they think might be responsible for the problem. Any additional encounters that result from these incursions should award XP as normal for encounters of their difficulty. While the rifts are likely to all lead to the same plane, particularly far-reaching disruptions might create gateways to multiple planes at once, with each rift spewing forth its own defenders. These groups would each have their own aims and agendas, clashing, collaborating, or causing chaos wherever they go.
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.disable: DC 42 Lore (expert) with the plane's Lore skill, @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master), @Check[nature|dc:45] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:45] (master), @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) or @Check[performance|dc:48] (legendary) to perform a planar stabilization rite to minimize the damage
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.routine:
(1+ hours, @Check[flat|dc:18]) Rifts detonate with raw planar essence. As the hazard progresses, the ruptures grow more frequent until they merge together into a gaping portal (this final stage might be prevented with good fortune or successful efforts to Prepare). Ruptures occur once per 10 minutes for the first hour and once per minute for the second hour. The frequency with which each unprepared creature in the area is hit by a rupture depends upon their proximity to the hazard's epicenter. If the hazard proceeds into a third hour, all creatures and objects in the area take the hazard's damage one final time before being swallowed up by the burgeoning portal and deposited on the other plane.

The planar explosions deal 2d12+18 damage, with a DC 42 basic saving throw, and inflict a condition on a failed saving throw. The damage type, saving throw type, condition, and condition duration depend upon the exploding plane, as detailed in the table below.
