Javownir.name: Javownir
Javownir.publicNotes: Beings of inscrutable intent and incredible power, dramofirs hail from the Dreamlands and shamble across the multiverse in search of dreams to incorporate into their voluminous robes. Few people on the Material Plane dare trifle with dramofirs and instead treat them with respect, hoping that they'll simply take their chosen victims' dreams and then go away. Often, this is exactly what happens. Every now and then, however, in the process of siphoning an individual's dreams, the dramofir slays their victim without warning or apparent cause.

action->Surreal Anatomy.name: Surreal Anatomy
action->Surreal Anatomy.description: A dramofir has resistance 10 to precision damage and the extra damage from critical hits. If the resistance is greater than the extra damage, it reduces the extra damage to 0 but doesn't reduce the attack's normal damage.

action->Bittersweet Dreams.name: Bittersweet Dreams
action->Bittersweet Dreams.description:
The dramofir swishes their robes in a mesmerizing display that brings the dreams in the robes to life before the viewer's very eyes. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save or be filled with ennui.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success For 1 round, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks, and all other emotion effects on it are suppressed.

Failure As success, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and the duration is [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Bittersweet Dreams]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As success, but the creature is also slowed 1, the status penalty is -2, and the duration is 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FginnDcOt4wfedf]{Effect: Bittersweet Dreams}

action->Replace Dream.name: Replace Dream
action->Replace Dream.description:
Requirements The dramofir is adjacent to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or sleeping creature

Effect The dramofir licks the creature's forehead, places their hand in the same spot, and siphons the creature's dreams to incorporate into their robes.

If the target is affected by any mental effect altering their dreams, such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.Y9SDbANT1DWI1DKU]{Animate Dream's} curse of endless nightmares or a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell, the dramofir attempts to counteract that effect (counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}). Otherwise, the dramofir plucks a benign dream from the creature, and the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the next time it gets a full night's rest.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and Javownir casts a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GP3wewkQXEPrLxYj]{Subconscious Suggestion} on the target (typically suggesting the target seeks out frightening situations so that their dreams become more nightmarish over time).

Kandirvek.name: Kandirvek
Kandirvek.publicNotes:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Kandirvek.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occul.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

action->Challenge Fate.name: Challenge Fate
action->Challenge Fate.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.

action->Untethered to Fate.name: Untethered to Fate
action->Untethered to Fate.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.

action->Destiny Breath.name: Destiny Breath
action->Destiny Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[13d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[will|dc:34|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Destiny Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

action->Prophetic Wings.name: Prophetic Wings
action->Prophetic Wings.description:
The dragon or any ally can glimpse into the future through the dragon's wings in a process that requires 10 minutes of concentration. This casts a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell, except that the wings can predict results up to 1 month into the future and the dragon always speaks a few cryptic words related to the result of the prediction.

The dragon can use their wings in this way only once per day, and a given creature can seek a future in the wings only once per week.

action->Walk the Timelines.name: Walk the Timelines
action->Walk the Timelines.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The dragon splits themself into two versions with different fates. Each copy Strides or Flies from the dragon's current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

After both actions, the dragon chooses one of the two locations as their actual destination and the other version of themself disappears.

Killing Fugue.name: Killing Fugue
Killing Fugue.descriptionHazard: A vision of a terrifying presence (the King in Yellow, the Crawling Chaos, or some other horror beyond imagining) overwhelms an unfortunate explorer, putting them into waking stupor that quickly turns into a homicidal fugue.
Killing Fugue.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:48] (master) to talk the affected individual out of the killing fugue, @Check[occultism|dc:45] (legendary) to recognize the spiritual attack taking place and help the victim to resist its effects; four successes are required to disable the nightmare
Killing Fugue.reset: As long as a creature remains under the effects of the nightmare, it cannot reset. Once a creature has either recovered from the effects or died, the nightmare resets in [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
Killing Fugue.routine:
(3 actions; curse) The killing fugue attempts to force a creature under the stupefying effects of deathly vision into taking violent actions against their allies. The affected creature can still take its normal turn of actions on its own turn, but on the killing fugue's turn they perform actions as decided upon by the GM. The killing fugue then spends the appropriate amount of actions to perform those actions and activities. The affected creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:curse] save each time the killing fugue attempts to force them to take actions in this way with the following results.

Critical Success The character throws off the killing fugue's influence, ending the nightmare.

Success The character prevents the killing fugue from taking the attempted action or activity.

Failure The character is forced to take the action or activity chosen by the killing fugue.

Critical Failure As failure, but the character can no longer attempt Will saves to resist the killing fugue.

action->Deathly Vision.name: Deathly Vision
action->Deathly Vision.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches within 10 feet of a site associated with the terrifying presence (such as a cairn, an altar, a cave, a strange skeleton, a waterfall, a pit, a statue, etc.)

Effect The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save, with the following effects. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} as long as the Killing Fugue remains active.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round and is stupefied 1 but is capable of whispering to anyone nearby that if anyone touches them, they will die.

Critical Failure As failure but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Knight of Malice.name: Knight of Malice
Knight of Malice.publicNotes:
Knights of malice are powerful, winged sinspawn, cultivated for the abundance of jealousy and hatred in their hearts. The knights scheme and strive to undermine each other, nourishing their animosity like any other soldier might train to foster camaraderie and teamwork with their allies. Each knight dreams of the day they prove their power and worthiness to the runelord of envy and reap their just rewards.

A Source of Malice

While other runelords abandoned the original sinspawn creation ritual in favor of using minor runewells, Belimarius instead innovated and perfected the original ritual used to create sinspawn, using it to empower a sinspawn through repeated and nested castings. Her knights of malice are washed in the souls of dozens of envious creatures each, reaching greater heights of envy than any other sinspawn.
Knight of Malice.allSavesBonus: +1 status to saves vs. magic, +4 status to saves vs. mental

weapon->Halberd.name: Halberd
weapon->Halberd.description: This polearm has a relatively short, 5-foot shaft. The business end is a long spike with an axe blade attached.

action->Sin Scent.name: Sin Scent
action->Sin Scent.description: A knight of malice can smell envious creatures as the scent ability, but as a precise sense. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately envious.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->+4 Status to All Saves vs. Menta.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

action->Jealous Enmity.name: Jealous Enmity
action->Jealous Enmity.description:
Trigger Another knight of malice successfully Strikes a creature within 15 feet

Requirements The knight of malice Seethed during their last turn

Effect The knight of malice Strides up to 15 feet and makes a melee Strike against the same creature. The knight of malice who rolled a higher result on their attack becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round and can use the extra action only to Seethe or Stride.

action->Spiteful Eye.name: Spiteful Eye
action->Spiteful Eye.description: 30 feet. Knights of malice hate to see others succeed and sabotage the efforts of other knights whenever they can. The knight of malice takes a –2 circumstance penalty to Reflex saving throws and their Strikes deal an extra 1d6 mental damage if there's at least one other knight of malice in the aura.

action->Seethe.name: Seethe
action->Seethe.description:
Requirements Another knight of malice is within the area of the knight's spiteful eye aura

Effect The knight of malice ruminates on their unjust treatment and plots a new method of overthrowing and outshining another knight. The knight of malice gains a second reaction until the start of their next turn, though they still can't use more than one reaction on the same triggering action.

action->Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
action->Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws Strike of a knight of malice must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save as it's assaulted by envious thoughts.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. For as long as it remains stupefied, the flat check to end the confused condition when the creature is damaged is DC 14.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}.

Kraken Caller.name: Kraken Caller
Kraken Caller.publicNotes:
Scouts, usually young sedacthies, ply the ocean in search of animal servants or tread ashore to hunt. Scouts hunting on the surface press crocodiles and snakes into service, while those underwater prefer electric eels and hippocampi.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

action->Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech
action->Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.

action->Shared Feast.name: Shared Feast
action->Shared Feast.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.

weapon->Naginata.name: Naginata
weapon->Naginata.description: This 6-foot staff has a 2-foot-long, slightly curved, swordlike blade attached at one end. The long pole helps keep the wielder out of reach of swords and shorter weapons.

action->Glimpse Uncertain Future.name: Glimpse Uncertain Future
action->Glimpse Uncertain Future.description:
Requirements Liralarue isn't stupefied

Trigger Liralarue fails a saving throw or attack roll

Effect Liralarue rerolls the saving throw or attack roll that triggered this reaction. She then experiences confusing visions of multiple futures all at once and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of her next turn.

action->Living Dream.name: Living Dream
action->Living Dream.description: Liralarue is made from solid dream-stuff. She no longer needs to sleep, breathe, eat, or drink. In return, she can't further develop her powers or exist outside the Dimension of Dreams—if she's forced out of the Dreamlands, she vanishes, then reappears 1 year later in the Dreamlands. She can be killed normally, but barring such an event, she could live forever as she no longer ages.

action->Beyond Dreams.name: Beyond Dreams
action->Beyond Dreams.description: When Liralarue casts the following spells on a PC or an item they carry while they're visiting her in dream, the lasting effects and results of that spell persist into the waking world: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dMKP4fkWx8V2cqAy]{Remake}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rsZ5c0AUyywe5yoK]{Retrocognition}.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Evasive Response.name: Evasive Response
action->Evasive Response.description: When Lograsi rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead. He isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of level 18 or lower.

action->Unexpected Parry.name: Unexpected Parry
action->Unexpected Parry.description:
Trigger A creature within Lograsi's reach attempts to Strike Lograsi with a melee weapon

Effect Lograsi attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. The triggering creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this attack. If the attack is a critical hit, Lograsi disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward his multiple attack penalty, and his multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Numbing Strike.name: Numbing Strike
action->Numbing Strike.description:
Trigger Lograsi's Strike hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature and deals damage

Effect The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a –10 foot status penalty to their Speeds from overwhelming chills that numb their flesh. This lasts until the end of Lograsi's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.cBxjqExA5RZ4UNAz]{Effect: Numbing Strike}

action->Shadowy Wings.name: Shadowy Wings
action->Shadowy Wings.description:
Trigger Lograsi rolls initiative or Leaps

Effect As one of the favored pawns of the velstrac demagogue Aroggus, Lograsi has been granted a pair of shadowy wings. When he activates his Shadowy Wings, they spring from his back and grant him a 40-foot fly Speed. He can sustain his Shadowy Wings for one round at the start of his turn as a free action. As long as his Shadowy Wings are active, Lograsi gains a +2 status bonus on all Acrobatics and Stealth checks.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Lograsi does an additional 3d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

Lythazossa.name: Lythazossa
Lythazossa.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Remove a Condition.name: Remove a Condition
action->Remove a Condition.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa ends one condition affecting her.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Mythic Resilience (Reflex).name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex)
action->Mythic Resilience (Reflex).description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When Lythazossa is destroyed, she re-forms after [[/gmr 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} in the Prosperity Vault, fully healed. She can be permanently destroyed if the apocalypse seed is removed from Varisia.

action->Undying Myth.name: Undying Myth
action->Undying Myth.description:
Cost all of Lythazossa's Mythic Points

Trigger Lythazossa would be destroyed and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa remains active, and recovers @Damage[140[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Calamitous Roar.name: Calamitous Roar
action->Calamitous Roar.description:
Lythazossa laments her cursed fate. Each living creature within 30 feet attempts a @Check[will|dc:42] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Calamitous Roar for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}

action->Recharge.name: Recharge
action->Recharge.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa can use Soul-Melting Breath again.

action->Reroll.name: Reroll
action->Reroll.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger Lythazossa fails a check

Effect Lythazossa rerolls the check.

action->Soul-Melting Breath.name: Soul-Melting Breath
action->Soul-Melting Breath.description: Lythazossa expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of ghostly acid that melts a creature's very soul, dealing @Damage[20d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[will|dc:42|basic] save). The ghostly acid also saps the life from affected creatures. At the beginning of Lythazossa's next turn, each creature that failed the Reflex save must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). Lythazossa can't use Soul-Melting Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul-Melting Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Telekinetic Assault.name: Telekinetic Assault
action->Telekinetic Assault.description: Lythazossa cries out in pain and anguish, hurling small objects and debris is a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save).

action->Vestige of an Ancient Curse.name: Vestige of an Ancient Curse
action->Vestige of an Ancient Curse.description: When Lythazossa hits a creature with her jaws Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until Lythazossa's spirit is put to rest. If the target critically fails this saving throw, Lythazossa regains 40 HP, and the target is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

Maddenmist.name: Maddenmist
Maddenmist.publicNotes:
High-ranking sedacthies are expected to both plan campaigns and wade into battle. These speakers achieve their rank by accumulating several large servants or a single massive creature like a megalodon.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

weapon->Staff of Arcane Might (Greater).name: Staff of Arcane Might (Greater)
weapon->Staff of Arcane Might (Greater).description:
This staff of magically hardened wood is topped with a silver sculpture depicting magical runic symbols. A staff of arcane might is a +2 greater striking staff.

Activate—Sunder 2 (death, force, manipulate)

Effect You destroy the staff, unleashing a blast of arcane power in a @Template[cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[2d8[force]] damage per charge remaining in the staff with a @Check[reflex|dc:35|traits:death,force|basic] save.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xqmHD8JIjak15lRk]{Phantasmal Minion}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ynm8JIU3sc3qUMpa]{Everlight}
  • 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DCQHaLrYXMI37dvW]{Paralyze}
  • 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.JOdOpbPDl7nqvJUm]{Dispelling Globe}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]{Mystic Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}
  • 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt}
  • 6th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]{Mystic Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Iela4GgVeO3LfAo]{Wall of Force}
  • 7th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xxWhyl81w3ckslAU]{Howling Blizzard}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed ranks of all listed spells.

equipment->Bands of Force (Greater).name: Bands of Force (Greater)
equipment->Bands of Force (Greater).description:
Decorated with clear gemstones, these thick metal bands spread an inflexible layer of force over your body. The force grants you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5 as armor. You can affix talismans to the bands as though they were light armor.

Activate—Return Force R (force, manipulate)

Trigger A creature critically misses you with a melee Strike

Effect You Shove the creature using the bands' Athletics modifier of [[/r d20+21]]{+21}.

action->Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech
action->Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Maddenmist is carrying his staff

Effect Maddenmist expends the magical power stored in his greater staff of arcane might. During the current turn, Maddenmist can cast one spell he prepared today and already cast without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).name: Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).descriptionHazard: The magically and mechanically automated tools Sorshen used to aid in the crafting of perfume on the long, eastern workbench have interacted in unexpected ways, transforming the workshop into a dangerous peril.
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).disable: @Check[crafting|dc:52] (legendary) to quickly introduce neutralizing agents into the alchemical machinery, @Check[thievery|dc:55] (master) to disable the mechanized portions of the devices, or @Check[arcana|dc:55] (master) to counteract magical elements; four total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying one of the four workbenches counts as one success)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).routine:
(5 actions) On its initiative, the malfunctioning perfumery takes the following five actions, in order. For each success at disabling it, the hazard loses one action. The targets for actions 2–5 are randomly chosen from creatures in the room, with no one creature being targeted more than once before all other creatures in the room have been targeted. For example, a party of 4 PCs will each be targeted by one of these actions. If just a single PC is in the room, they will be targeted by all four.

  • 1: Crushing Notes 1 (olfactory, poison) The malfunctioning machinery exudes a blast of concentrated and overwhelming perfume notes into area B11. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:olfactory,poison] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).
  • 2: Nozzle Spray 1 (poison) Nozzles built into the machinery extend out to spray toxic, overwhelmingly cloying perfume in multiple directions. One randomly determined target in area B11 takes @Damage[14d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:poison] save).
  • 3: Sillage 1 (emotion, mental) A larger, more intimidating nozzle than the one utilized in the previous action extends forward and violently sprays a staggering array of different scents at a random target in the room. The overwhelming mixture of lingering scent (the perfume's sillage) causes the creature to take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic|traits:emotion,mental] save); on a failed save, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round by the overwhelming scents.
  • 4: Oil Spill 1 (fire) Sparks from grinding machinery ignite a patch of spilled oil somewhere in the room—a random creature in area B11 takes @Damage[10d6[fire],4d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:fire] save).
  • 5: Boiling Beaker 1 (emotion, mental) A pressurized beaker containing boiling fluids springs a leak, and a dislodged tube sprays disorienting, psychotropic fumes at a random creature in the room, who must then succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44|traits:emotion,mental] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).

action->Pungent Cloud.name: Pungent Cloud
action->Pungent Cloud.description:
Trigger The door to area B11 is opened or a creature enters the area, or any open flame is brought into area B11

Effect The musky fog filling the perfume laboratory billows out into the hall, spreading 5 feet from the doorway and expanding by another 5 feet each round the door remains open. All creatures within the fog become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the fog become concealed to creatures within it. Creatures in the fog must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:45|traits:poison|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure); this is a poison effect. If the pungent cloud was triggered by open flame, chemicals in the air ignite into a flash of fire, dealing @Damage[6d6[fire],6d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect] save), after which the pungent cloud disperses. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).name: Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).descriptionHazard: The magically and mechanically automated tools Sorshen used to aid in the crafting of perfume on the long, eastern workbench have interacted in unexpected ways, transforming the workshop into a dangerous peril.
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).disable: @Check[crafting|dc:52] (legendary) to quickly introduce neutralizing agents into the alchemical machinery, @Check[thievery|dc:55] (master) to disable the mechanized portions of the devices, or @Check[arcana|dc:55] (master) to counteract magical elements; four total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying one of the four workbenches counts as one success)

  • 4: Oil Spill 1 (fire) Sparks from grinding machinery ignite a patch of spilled oil somewhere in the room—a random creature in area B11 takes @Damage[10d6[fire],4d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:fire] save).
